member.name: WS_SECURITY_BINDING_PROPERTY_CONSTRAINT
member.summary: This structure is used to specify a set of constraints for a particular security binding property. Any property constraints that are not specified will use the default constraints.

summary.para: The id of the security binding property. The following security binding property constraints may be specified:

item.description:
This property constraint may be specified when the security binding is specified.
If this property is not specified, then the default constraint value of will be used.

member.name: WS_SECURITY_BINDING_PROPERTY_CONSTRAINT.allowedValues
member.summary: An array of values which are acceptable. The type of the values in the array correspond to the type of the values of the security binding property. See the documentation for a particular security binding property to determine the type of the property.

member.name: WS_SECURITY_BINDING_PROPERTY_CONSTRAINT.allowedValuesSize
member.summary: The total size of the allowedValues array, in bytes. This size must be a multiple of the size of the type of the value of the property.

member.name: WS_SECURITY_BINDING_PROPERTY_CONSTRAINT.out
member.summary: When returns NOERROR, the fields of the property structure will be filled out as follows:
